src:
Eryk Anders Defends Split Decision Win at UFC Tampa, Potential Move to WWE - Pull No Punches Ep. 42
06 Nov 2019, 20:00 by June M. Williams



Your hosts ‘Shak’ Shakiel Mahjouri & former UFC fighter, Kajan Johnson are here each Wednesday as “MMA’s most colorful and entertaining personalities”. They will present you a half hour or so of MMA content, varying from fighter interviews to discussions on current MMA Topics.
Eryk Anders drops by the podcast following a split decision win at UFC Tampa. Anders reflects on the fight, discusses breaking up an “altercation” between Goldberg and Dolph Ziggler, developing a friendship with pornstar Kendra Lust, savvy investing and more.
Discussion Points:

0:35 - Eryk Anders on split decision win at UFC Tampa
4:35 - Eryk Anders broke up a “fight” between Goldberg and Dolph Ziggler
5:30 - Eryk Anders on a potential move to WWE
6:10 - Pornstar Kendra Lust’s ties to MMA
10:25 - BJ Penn issues
13:15 - Preparing life after MMA

Poll
Do you think Eryk Anders won at UFC Tampa

YES
NO

vote view results

72% YES (21 votes)
27% NO (8 votes)

29 votes total Vote Now
You can follow the guys on Twitter: Shak - @ThisIsShak, Kajan - @IamRagin and follow the pages for the @PNPShow on twitter, Instagram, or facebook. Plus, you can watch for articles from Shak Mahjouri right here on Bloody Elbow as well.
Related Eryk Anders Defends Split Decision Win at UFC Tampa, Potential Move to WWE - Pull No Punches Ep. 42
If you enjoyed our show, give us a shout out in the comments here on Bloody Elbow, or give us a “like”, share & subscribe over on one of our other BE Presents Channels: SoundCloud, YouTube, iTunes & Apple TV, iHeartRadio, Stitcher, Spotify, Google Play, TuneIn, OverCast, or Player FM – whichever one happens to be your listening platform of choice. While you’re there, don’t forget to subscribe to Bloody Elbow Presents; that way you’ll always be the first to get all of BE’s daily MMA offerings. For previous episodes of the show, check out our playlists on all of our BE Presents channels.
